Package com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow

Class QorusNormalStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qoretechnologies.qorus.OMQ
      • com.qoretechnologies.qorus.UserApi
        • com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi
          • com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.QorusStepBase
            • com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.QorusNormalStep
  • public abstract class QorusNormalStep
extends QorusStepBase
    The abstract class for normalsteps "normal steps" Example 
    
// name: MyNormalStepClass
// version: 1.0
// desc: my normal step class
// lang: java8
import com.qoretechnologies.qorus.OMQ;
import com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.QorusNormalStep;

public class MyNormalStepClass implements QorusNormalStep {
    public void primary() throws Throwable {
        // ... primary step logic
    }

    public String validation() throws Throwable {
        # call checkAction() to check in the target DB if the action has completed
        if (checkAction()) {
            return OMQ.StatComplete;
        }

        // call checkPending() to see if we retry or still wait
        return checkPending() ? OMQ.StatAsyncWaiting : OMQ.StatRetry;
    }

    public boolean checkAction() {
        // .. logic here
    }

    public boolean checkPending() {
        // .. logic here
    }
}
// END
    See Also:
    normalsteps
    Note:
    Qorus step constructors do not take any arguments; see classstepconstructors for information about constructors and static class initialization.

      java.lang.String validation()
      Validation logic for the step This method must be overridden for steps that can only execute once; by default this method will return OMQ.StatRetry, meaning that the primary step logic will be repeated.

    • Method Detail

      • primary

        public abstract void primary()
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        The primary step logic for the normal step
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • validation

        public java.lang.String validation()
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Validation logic for the step This method must be overridden for steps that can only execute once; by default this method will return OMQ.StatRetry, meaning that the primary step logic will be repeated.
        Returns:
        this must be one of the following StatusDescriptions "step status constants":
        • OMQ.StatComplete "StatComplete": do not run the primary step logic; mark the step as "COMPLETE" and continue
        • OMQ.StatError "StatError": do not run the primary step logic; mark the step as "ERROR" and stop running any further dependencies of this step
        • OMQ.StatRetry "StatRetry": run the step function again immediately
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - any exceptions are converted to %Qore exceptions and processed as workflow errors
        See Also:
        validationfunc, "Non-Repeatable Steps Must Include Validation"
        Note:
        if any other value than the above is returned, an error is raised and the return value is treated like OMQ.StatError
